name: Areca Palm
definition: Dypsis lutescens is a clumping, tropical palm tree known for its slender, arching fronds with feathery leaflets and yellowish stems. It’s widely grown as an ornamental plant for indoor decor and outdoor landscaping in warm climates.
benefits: Air purification
Humidity regulation
Non-toxic
Soil stabilization
medicalUse: No significant medicinal use
Mainly grown for ornamental and environmental purposes, not for herbal medicine
ornamentalUse: Feathery, arching fronds give a tropical and elegant appearance
Suitable for pots, patios, and garden borders
propagation: Division and seeds
Separating clumps or suckers from mature plants
Can also be grown from seeds, though growth is slow

name: Aloe vera (L.) Burm. F.
definition: Aloe vera is a stemless or short-stemmed succulent plant in the Asphodelaceae family, known for its thick, fleshy, serrated leaves that contain a gel-rich in bioactive compounds. It’s widely cultivated for medicinal, cosmetic, and ornamental use.
benefits: Soothes sunburns, skin irritation, rashes, and minor wounds; moisturizes skin and promotes healing.
Nourishes scalp, reduces dandruff, and strengthens hair.
Internal use (with caution): Aids digestion, may regulate blood sugar, and provides antioxidants.
medicalUse: Skin treatment
Hair Care
Digestive aid
Anti-inflammatory
Antimicrobial
ornamentalUse: Attractive succulent with thick green leaves
Low maintenance and drought-tolerant
Commonly used as an indoor and outdoor decorative plant
propagation: Vegetative propagation
Through offsets or “pups” that grow at the base of the parent plant
Pups are removed and planted in well-drained soil

name: Madagascar periwingkle
definition: Madagascar periwinkle is an evergreen, tender, erect-to-spreading perennial in the dogbane family (Apocynaceae). It is native to Madagascar but has naturalized in warm areas around the world. The species epithet means 'pink.'
benefits: Air Purification.
Educational Value widely studied for its medicinal compounds, especially in cancer research.
Scientific use contains alkaloids such as vincristine and vinblastine.
medicalUse: Leaf decoctions are sometimes used for diabetes, high blood pressure, and wound cleaning.
Used in modern medicine to treat certain types of cancer, including leukemia and lymphoma.
ornamentalUse: Popular for its small but bright flowers in pink, white, red, and purple shades.
Used as ground cover, garden borders, and potted plants.
propagation: Grown from seeds or stem cuttings.
Seeds are sown in well-drained soil, while cuttings root easily in moist soil.

name: False Ashoka Tree
definition: A tall, evergreen tree known for its slender, columnar growth habit and wavy-edged leaves.
benefits: Dust and air pollution are reduced by the use of air filtering systems.
Sound mitigation as a natural sound barrier, thick leaves lower noise levels.
Used along roads and schools to deflect strong winds.
Used as privacy barriers or screen planting.
medicalUse: Leaves and bark are used for fighting bacteria and fungi, or for treating fever, diabetes symptoms, high blood pressure, and even intestinal worms, especially in Ayurvedic practices.
ornamentalUse: Tall, narrow, and grow symmetrically.
Enhance the look of gardens, parks, and roadsides.
Grow in a more or less upright and uniform manner and their growth habit is dense.
propagation: Through stem cuttings or air layering.

name: Ramgoat Dashalong
definition: Turnera ulmifolia is a perennial, woody herb or erect shrub in the Passifloraceae (formerly Turneraceae) family. It’s recognized by its lanceolate/ovate serrated leaves and bright yellow, star-shaped flowers that open in the morning and close by afternoon. It’s valued for ornamental and medicinal uses.
benefits: Ornamental value dried leaves used for tea, flavoring.
Traditional medicinal uses for various ailments.
medicalUse: Traditionally used for sexual dysfunction, menopause symptoms, colds, fever, anxiety, digestive issues, and as an expectorant/antidiabetic.
ornamentalUse: Features showy, five-petaled yellow flowers that bloom year-round (each flower lasts one day). Can be used as ground cover, border, or foundation plant; attracts butterflies.
propagation: From seeds sown in well-drained soil, or stem cuttings rooted in warm, moist conditions with indirect light.

name: Rubber Fig
definition: A large tropical evergreen tree or ornamental houseplant known for its thick, glossy leaves that produce a milky latex used in making natural rubber.
benefits: Air Purification.
Its large green leaves help create a calming indoor environment.
medicalUse: Traditional applications In some cultures, plant sap and leaves are used externally for skin problems and minor wounds.
ornamentalUse: Popular for its large, glossy, dark-green leaves that enhance interior spaces.
Used as an indoor houseplant or outdoor ornamental tree in tropical areas.
propagation: Through stem cuttings or air layering.
Cuttings are rooted in moist, well-drained soil.

name: Song of India
definition: A tropical evergreen shrub known for its glossy, lance-shaped leaves arranged spirally around the stem. It is a popular ornamental houseplant valued for its attractive foliage and air-purifying qualities.
benefits: Valuable ornamental foliage plant with attractive variegation.
Helps improve indoor air quality by removing pollutants.
Low maintenance and drought-tolerant.
medicalUse: Leaf/stem extracts are used for minor ailments like cuts and inflammation.
Alleviating coughs or respiratory irritation.
ornamentalUse: Used as a decorative indoor and outdoor plant.
Elegant vertical growth and striking variegated leaves.
propagation: Best for stem cuttings in soil or water.
Air-layering for larger specimens.

name: West Indian Jasmine
definition: A flowering tropical shrub known for its bright red, pink, or orange flower clusters.
benefits: Bright clusters of flowers add ornamental beauty to gardens
Attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies
medicalUse: Use as a sedative for nausea or loss of appetite
Leaves and flowers used for skin issues and sores
Leaf infusions are used to treat diarrhea and ulcers
ornamentalUse: Popular hedge and garden shrub with dense, showy blooms
Flowers available in red, pink, yellow and other cultivars
propagation: Propagated via stem cuttings or seeds
Best planted in well-drained soil with regular moisture

name: Aratiles Tree
definition: A fast-growing tropical fruit tree known for its small, sweet red berries.
benefits: Provides sweet edible fruit enjoyed fresh or in jams
Fast-growing shade tree for gardens and streets
Attracts birds and wildlife with nectar and fruit
medicalUse: Leaves used for tea to alleviate headaches and inflammation
Flowers and bark used as antiseptic agents
Sometimes used for respiratory issues and antidiarrheal purposes
ornamentalUse: Attractive small tree with delicate white flowers and bright red berries
Common in tropical gardens and along roadsides
propagation: Easily propagated from seeds with high germination rates
Can also grow from cuttings in suitable soil

name: Ti Plant
definition: The Ti plant, or Cordyline fruticosa, is an evergreen shrub prized for its vibrant, colorful foliage. It's often used as an ornamental plant, both indoors and outdoors, in tropical and subtropical climates.
benefits: Air Purification
Resilient and Adaptable for indoor and outdoor growing
medicalUse: Can help lower fever
Used to relieve muscle/nerve aches, headache, sore throat, and arthritis
Used for swelling, infections, eczema, and wounds
Used for dysentery and toothaches
Sometimes used to treat filariasis, gastrointestinal issues, and as a diuretic
ornamentalUse: Landscaping & Garden Design
Container Gardening
Indoor Accent
Cut Foliage/Floral Design
Foliage Color Variations
propagation: Through stem cuttings or division
Best done in spring or early summer; roots form within 2-6 weeks

name: Snake Plant
definition: A hardy ornamental plant with long upright sword-shaped leaves.
benefits: Air Purification
Nighttime Oxygen Production
Mental Health Boost
Reduces Allergies
Low maintenance and Durable
medicalUse: Leaf sap is used to treat burns, skin cuts, sores, and inflammation
Support standard blood pressure
Help strengthen the immune system
Help flush out parasites
Relieve headaches
ornamentalUse: Modern Aesthetic
Space Saving Structure
Versatile Varieties
propagation: Through leaf cutting or, more effectively, by dividing the rhizomes
Best done in spring or summer via division, water, or soil cuttings

name: Mulberry Tree
definition: A fruit-bearing tree that produces small sweet edible berries.
benefits: Fruits are rich in vitamin C, antioxidants, and minerals
Support heart health, boost immunity, and aid cognitive function
Leaves can be made into tea to help regulate blood sugar and cholesterol
medicalUse: Used to treat dry skin, improve circulation, and lower uric acid
Nourish the liver and enhance eyesight
Potential effects against cancer, aging, and inflammation
ornamentalUse: Features lush foliage, spring blooms, and colorful fruits
Can be shaped into hedges or used as shade trees
Attracts birds and pollinators
propagation: Hardwood or semi-hardwood cuttings during late winter to early spring

name: Bloodberry
definition: A tropical American herb with racemes of red berries resembling those of pokeweed.
benefits: Has anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and antimicrobial properties
Soothes inflammation and reduces pain
Supports digestive wellness and promotes skin healing
medicalUse: Leaves treat wounds
Supports women's reproductive health
Addresses skin conditions like rashes, cuts, and bruises
Relieves headache, joint, and muscle pain
ornamentalUse: Lush green leaves with tiny pink-white flowers and brilliant red berries
Suitable for borders and shady spots under trees
Attracts birds, butterflies, and bees
propagation: Seeds and stem cuttings
Cuttings root easily in moist soil or water

name: Devil's Backbone / Zigzag Plant
definition: An erect succulent shrub with green, zig-zag shaped branches.
benefits: Sap has anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties
Helps purify air
Low maintenance
medicalUse: Used topically for wounds, burns, and skin irritations
Treats muscle/joint pain and fungal infections
Used in some cultures for respiratory issues and as a diuretic
ornamentalUse: Valued for its unique zigzag stems and glossy leaves
Suitable for containers, rock gardens, and indoor spaces
propagation: Can be propagated by stem cuttings
Cuttings should dry for a few days before planting

name: Prickly Pear Cactus
definition: A cactus characterized by flat, paddle-shaped stems and spiky thorns. The prickly pear typically grows with flat, rounded cladodes (also called platyclades).
benefits: Air Purification
Highly drought-resistant and helps prevent soil erosion
medicalUse: Cactus pads used to help manage blood sugar levels and treat wounds
Reduces inflammation
Rich in fiber and antioxidants that support digestion and heart health
ornamentalUse: Unique spiny appearance and bright flowers or fruits
Used in rock gardens and decorative pots
propagation: Through pads (cuttings)
Mature pads are dried for a few days then planted in well-drained soil

name: Golden Trumpet
definition: A tropical, evergreen, perennial vine in the dogbane family (Apocynaceae). It is cultivated for its showy, golden yellow flowers.
benefits: Adds visual appeal to landscapes
Attracts pollinators like bees and butterflies
Drought-tolerant
medicalUse: Used as laxative/emetic
Treats malaria, jaundice, wounds, and headaches
ornamentalUse: Features bright golden-yellow trumpet-shaped flowers
Can be trained as a vine or shrub
propagation: Best propagated in spring via semi-hardwood stem cuttings

name: Sour Orange
definition: Dalandan is a small, erect tree with smooth, greenish white shoots with spinescent thorns.
benefits: High Vitamin C content for immune support
Bioflavonoids provide anti-inflammatory and antioxidant activities
Aids digestion and mildly suppresses appetite
medicalUse: Relieving indigestion, gas, or minor constipation
Peels used for antiseptic and antimicrobial qualities
Used to treat skin diseases and general cleansing
ornamentalUse: Small evergreen citrus with white flowers and dark green leaves
Used in home gardens
propagation: Grafting to fruit trees
Seeds take a few weeks to sprout in warm conditions

name: Croton Pictum
definition: A tropical ornamental plant widely known for its thick, glossy, and brightly colored leaves that display combinations of green, yellow, red, orange, and purple.
benefits: Air Purification helps filter indoor air toxins
Used in local traditions for decorative purposes during festivals
medicalUse: Leaf extracts used topically for skin rashes and wounds
Roots used for digestive issues
Potential anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties
ornamentalUse: Colorful leaves in shades of red, orange, yellow, and purple
Used as hedges, accent shrubs, or potted plants
propagation: Stem cuttings taken in spring/summer
Root in moist soil or water

name: Guava
definition: The guava is a tropical fruit-bearing shrub or small tree known for its high nutritional value. The fruit is a berry with a characteristic “musky” aroma, containing numerous small, hard seeds embedded in a sweet, pulpy flesh.
benefits: Edible fruit rich in vitamin C, vitamin A, and fiber
Versatile use in jams, juices, and jellies
medicalUse: Leaves and bark used as antiseptic for wounds
Fresh leaves help with toothaches or as mouthwash
Tea from leaves eases diarrhea and stomach troubles
ornamentalUse: Sweet-smelling flowers and thick green canopy
Attractive shade tree for yards
propagation: Through cuttings, air-layering, or grafting

name: Bougainvillea
definition: A tropical woody climbing plant known for its vibrant, showy bracts that surround smal, inconspicuous flower.
benefits: Attracts pollinators
Low maintenance and drought-tolerant
medicalUse: Used for coughs, colds, and sore throat
Mild anti-inflammatory and antibacterial remedy
ornamentalUse: Known for bright, colorful bracts in pink, purple, red, and white
Long-lasting blooms for landscaping and containers
propagation: Through stem cuttings
Layering
